Youtube

Youtube has a wide variety of channels and playlists that can help you learn. You can find anything at Youtube.

Web Development Tutorials: Ultimate Playlist (2018)

Visit

Curated by Udemy Tech, this is a playlist of some of Udemy's best instructors (Colt Steel has an amazing web dev course, and a SQL course, and Maximillian Schwarzemuller has a good course on Angular) that covers web development from the basics to JavaScript, to back end development with Node.js.

JavaScript ES6

Visit

This is a playlist of videos by Steven Griffin, a web developer since 1997, about the features available in ES6. He goes into detail through the finer points of destructuring, the fetch API, fat arrow functions and so on and so forth.

Traversy Media

Visit

I've learned a lot from this channel. This is the channel that introduced me to webpack, grunt, Vue.js and many more things, including an hour long crash course into React. Brad Traversy explains everything very well and moves at a pace that even beginners can keep up.
